thread.title: A Gentle Irish Wolfhound Breaks the Guinness World Record for the Longest Tail on a Dog
thread.title_full: A Gentle Irish Wolfhound Breaks the Guinness World Record for the Longest Tail on a Dog

author: Lori Dorn
title: A Gentle Irish Wolfhound Breaks the Guinness World Record for the Longest Tail on a Dog
text:
A sweet and gentle Irish Wolfhound named Keon (“courageous warrior”), who lives with his family in the Flemish town of Westerlo, Belgium has broken the previous Guinness World Record for “ the Longest tail on a dog “, setting the bar a little higher for the next dog to challenge his title.
Before achieving this record, Keon was required to be examined by a professional vet, who measured the tail from the top of the bone to the tip – not including the hair. Keon is an Irish name that means “courageous warrior”, but his owner Ilse Loodts says that he is a gentle giant.
Related Laughing Squid Posts ‘Two Subwoofers’, An Irish Wolfhound Wears A Pair of Dachshunds On Either Side of a Saddle Bag Dog That Has the Longest Ears in the World Texas Longhorn Awarded Guinness World Record for the Longest Horn Spread on a Living Domestic Steer
